intro: Mabea subsessilis var. peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian mabea, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a shrub characterized by its woody stems and aromatic leaves, which are often used in traditional medicine. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem. It thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
